oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Abstracts of ordnance and ordnance stores lost
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States. Army -- Ordnance and ordnance stores; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-page handwritten ordnance abstract form, designated No. 3, which conveys by date, certificate number, quantity, and class the ordnance lost during the fourth quarter of 1864 for which Captain R. H. M. Donnelly of Company D, 13th Tennessee Cavalry, U. S. A., was responsible.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Ordnance Corps
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The 13th Tennessee Cavalry regiment was organized in East Tennessee; nine companies mustered in at Strawberry Plains on October 28 and November 8, 1863, and mustered out at Knoxville, Tennessee, on September 5, 1865. A Civil War form designated as an abstract conveys a cumulative report.
